translated: The One-hundred and eighty-one Connected Discourses

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Sekhassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appattamānasassa anuttaraṁ yogakkhemaṁ patthayamānassa
analyzed: sekhassa bhikkhave bhikkhunaḥ appatta mānasassa anuttaram yogakkhemam patthayamānassa
translated: “Monks, for a monk in training, who has not attained his heart’s desire, who is desirous of unexcelled rest from the yoke,

original: viharato ajjhattikaṁ aṅganti karitvā nāññaṁ ekaṅgampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ bahūpakāraṁ🔽yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikāro.
analyzed: viharataḥ ajjhattikam aṅga nti karitvā na aññam eka aṅgam pi samanupassāmi yam evam bahu upakāra  bhikkhave yonisaḥ manasikāro
translated: while dwelling heedful, ardent, & resolute, I don’t envision even one other thing that so contributes to his attainment of the unattained, to his realization of the realized, as skillful attention.

original: Yoniso, bhikkhave, bhikkhu manasi karonto akusalaṁ pajahati, kusalaṁ bhāvetī”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: yonisaḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu manasi karontaḥ akusalam pajahati kusalam bhāveti iti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: Skillful attention is what so contributes to his attainment of the unattained, to his realization of the realized.”🔽The Blessed One spoke of this matter,
and in so doing, he said:
is the Dhamma for a monk in training.
There is no other single thing
that so contributes to the realization of the ultimate🔽as skillful attention.

original: khayaṁ dukkhassa pāpuṇe”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: khayam dukkhassa pāpuṇeti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: will reach the ending of stress.”
This is the meaning the Blessed One spoke of, and in reference to this matter he said it.🔽The sixth section on “as it was said” is finished.
